p: As the technical difficulties of extracting high quality DNA from historical materials are being overcome (Bieker and Martin, 2018), herbarium materials are also increasingly being used in genomic studies at all scales, from populations to phylogenies (Kuzmina et al., 2017; Bieker and Martin, 2018) as well as to study domestication history (da Fonseca et al., 2015) or plant pathogens (Yoshida et al., 2014).
